div.h2: Welcome to West Point Independent School District

br.p: Due to the increased spread of Covid-19 and recent recommendations by Governor Andy Beshear and the Kentucky Department of Education, WPS will be making a couple of adjustments to our support for our West Point students. Please read below and call your child’s teacher or the main office (502) 922-4797 if you have questions or we can be of service to you.

Beginning Monday April 13th, our food distribution will be limited to Monday and Thursday. Meals for Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday will be distributed on Mondays and meals for Thursday and Friday will be distributed on Thursdays. The times and locations will remain the same. Limiting to these days will increase safety for our staff who have done an incredible job thus far. We want to decrease their exposure and keep them healthy!

If your student needs the use of a Chromebook, please call the school office at (502) 922-4797 and speak with Penelope Helm or Pam Brown. We will be delivering these to your homes to help you stay “Healthy at Home”.
Above all, enjoy this Easter weekend and time with your family.

br.br: New page: Parents and Students, there is a new Related Arts NTI page.

span.br: page. You'll find some NTI work there from Mr.B, so be sure to check it out!

br.span: New page: Please check out the new Principal's Page!

br.span: A letter concerning the future of West Point Independent has been posted here:

a.title: Future of West Point Independent Letter
a.style: font-family: latobold; font-size: medium; text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: medium; letter-spacing: 0.3px; text-align: center; font-family: latobold;

span.span:
West Point Independent School serves students in Pre-School through Grade 8 in the community of West Point, KY located in Hardin County on the Ohio River. The school's mission is to offer students a positive learning environment filled with high expectations. Our professional staff is fully qualified with experience levels ranging across the spectrum of their profession.
We have numerous programs to serve our students and our community. Some of these are Family Resource Youth Center, Family Literacy, ESL, School Wide Title I, Extended School Services, Gifted & Talented, Athletics, and Academic Team Activities.
